parameters.prompt:
Please complete the following task:

Write a welcome message for new users joining our platform
parameters.current_task: Write a welcome message for new users joining our platform

output.content:
Welcome to {PlatformName}!

We’re excited to have you here. You’ve just joined a community built to help you {core value proposition – e.g., “collaborate effortlessly,” “grow your business,” “learn faster,” etc.}. Let’s get you set up for success.

Quick start (takes 3 minutes):
1. Confirm your email (if you haven’t already).
2. Complete your profile (add a photo, bio, and any relevant preferences).
3. Explore your dashboard to see recommended next steps.
4. Try a first action (e.g., create a project, join a group, start a trial task).
5. Set your notifications so you only get what matters.

Key features you can use today:
- Dashboard: Your personalized activity and insights.
- Search & Discover: Find people, content, or tools quickly.
- Workspaces / Projects: Organize everything in one place.
- Notifications & Alerts: Stay informed without noise.
- Help Center & Tutorials: Learn at your own pace.

Community guidelines (the essentials):
- Be respectful and constructive.
- Protect privacy—yours and others’.
- Share accurate, lawful content.
- Report issues; don’t engage in harassment.
- No spam or unsolicited promotions.

Need help?
- Help Center: {HelpCenterLink}
- Email support: {SupportEmail}
- Live chat: Available weekdays 9:00–17:00 (UTC)
- Status page: {StatusPageLink} (for uptime and incidents)

Pro tips:
- Bookmark your dashboard for faster access.
- Enable two-factor authentication for better security.
- Follow topics or categories to tailor your feed.
- Check your weekly summary email for progress insights.

We’re listening:
Send feedback anytime via the Feedback button or at {FeedbackEmail}. Your input directly shapes our roadmap.

Short versions you can reuse:

In-app banner:
Welcome aboard! Explore your dashboard, complete your profile, and start your first action. Need help? Visit {HelpCenterLink}.

Email subject:
Welcome to {PlatformName} – Let’s get you started

Email preview text:
Activate your account and unlock your personalized experience in just a few clicks.

Social/Community post:
A warm welcome to all our new members this week! Dive in, introduce yourself, and let us know what you’re building.

If you’d like a version tailored to a specific audience (developers, educators, creators, teams, etc.), just let me know.

We’re glad you’re here—let’s build something great together.

— The {PlatformName} Team

parameters.prompt:
Analyze the output of the following text and extract any new task descriptions that need to be executed by agent. New task description is wrapped by <new task to execute> tag or other xml tag with similar meaning. If there is no such tag, do not consider it as new task to extract.

**Important notes:**
1. Only extract tasks that clearly and necessarily need to be executed next to achieve the intended deliverable, do not speculate.
2. Task descriptions should be clear and specific. Make sure the task is understandable without any additional context. Keep reference documentation path as it is.
3. If a reference doc is mentioned, include it in the task description.
4. There can be overlap between task descriptions. Make sure each description is comprehensive and non-duplicative.
5. Please use the original task description's language as your response language.
6. If there is duplicate task with "Task list waiting for execute", skip the duplicated task and do not add it in tasks array.

Here is the text that needs analysis:

<Task output content to analyze>
<content>
Welcome to {PlatformName}!

We’re excited to have you here. You’ve just joined a community built to help you {core value proposition – e.g., “collaborate effortlessly,” “grow your business,” “learn faster,” etc.}. Let’s get you set up for success.

Quick start (takes 3 minutes):
1. Confirm your email (if you haven’t already).
2. Complete your profile (add a photo, bio, and any relevant preferences).
3. Explore your dashboard to see recommended next steps.
4. Try a first action (e.g., create a project, join a group, start a trial task).
5. Set your notifications so you only get what matters.

Key features you can use today:
- Dashboard: Your personalized activity and insights.
- Search & Discover: Find people, content, or tools quickly.
- Workspaces / Projects: Organize everything in one place.
- Notifications & Alerts: Stay informed without noise.
- Help Center & Tutorials: Learn at your own pace.

Community guidelines (the essentials):
- Be respectful and constructive.
- Protect privacy—yours and others’.
- Share accurate, lawful content.
- Report issues; don’t engage in harassment.
- No spam or unsolicited promotions.

Need help?
- Help Center: {HelpCenterLink}
- Email support: {SupportEmail}
- Live chat: Available weekdays 9:00–17:00 (UTC)
- Status page: {StatusPageLink} (for uptime and incidents)

Pro tips:
- Bookmark your dashboard for faster access.
- Enable two-factor authentication for better security.
- Follow topics or categories to tailor your feed.
- Check your weekly summary email for progress insights.

We’re listening:
Send feedback anytime via the Feedback button or at {FeedbackEmail}. Your input directly shapes our roadmap.

Short versions you can reuse:

In-app banner:
Welcome aboard! Explore your dashboard, complete your profile, and start your first action. Need help? Visit {HelpCenterLink}.

Email subject:
Welcome to {PlatformName} – Let’s get you started

Email preview text:
Activate your account and unlock your personalized experience in just a few clicks.

Social/Community post:
A warm welcome to all our new members this week! Dive in, introduce yourself, and let us know what you’re building.

If you’d like a version tailored to a specific audience (developers, educators, creators, teams, etc.), just let me know.

We’re glad you’re here—let’s build something great together.

— The {PlatformName} Team
</content>
<tool_calls>
[]
</tool_calls>
</Task output content to analyze>

<Task list waiting for execute>
No tasks waiting in queue
</Task list waiting for execute>

function.name: extract_new_tasks
function.description: Extract new task descriptions that need to be executed by the agent

think_process.description: The process of analyze if there is new task for to do, and if there is any task duplicate with task list waiting for execute.

tasks.description: List of new task descriptions that need to be executed, each task should be a valid json string, be careful when you escape newline and quotes ". Empty array if no new tasks found.

arguments.think_process: Reviewed provided content for XML-like tags indicating new tasks (e.g., <new task to execute> or similar). The content includes onboarding guidance and suggestions but no explicitly tagged tasks. Therefore, no extractable tasks per instructions. No existing task queue items, so no duplication check needed.

parameters.prompt:
<instructions>
You are a helpful agent which can perform task like run comamnd / code / search data / thinking on behalf of user. You are receiving root task description to execute, and you have performed some work for it. Your work's output is provided in aggregated_outputs.

Right now, you need to evaluate whether your work has satisfied the root task requirements. 

1. First, you need to think about what user wants to achieve, what is expected process and output, what we have performed. Only consider requirement not met if some requirement totally missed. Eg. We need to run a command and command not exists. Or if we need to write a paragraph and no text outputed.
2. If requirements are NOT met, list specific failing aspects and create new tasks to address them, so that user's end goal can be achieved.
3. If requirements ARE met, provide a summary and which path in the aggregated_outputs should be used to consider as the output, put them in the useful_output_path.

Use the evaluate_and_summarize_subtree function to provide your evaluation.
</instructions>

<root_task_description>Write a command which can list out the contents of the home directory. Task: Write a welcome message for new users joining our platform</root_task_description>
<root_task_short_name>Write a command which can list out the contents...</root_task_short_name>


<work you have performed>
<output_path>$.llm_result</output_path>
<content>{'content': 'Welcome to {PlatformName}!

We’re excited to have you here. You’ve just joined a community built to help you {core value proposition – e.g., “collaborate effortlessly,” “grow your business,” “learn faster,” etc.}. Let’s get you set up for success.

Quick start (takes 3 minutes):

3. Explore your dashboard to see recommended next steps.
4. Try a first action (e.g., create a project, join a group, start a trial task).
5. Set your notifications so you only get what matters.

Key features you can use today:
- Dashboard: Your personalized activity and insights.
- Search & Discover: Find people, content, or tools quickly.
- Workspaces / Projects: Organize everything in one place.
- Notifications & Alerts: Stay informed without noise.
- Help Center & Tutorials: Learn at your own pace.

Community guidelines (the essentials):

- No spam or unsolicited promotions.

Need help?

function.name: evaluate_and_summarize_subtree
function.description: Evaluate if subtree meets root task requirements and provide summary or missing items

think_process.description: analyze if requirement is met and if not met, what is missing, and how to fix the missing part.

requirements_met.description: True if root task requirements are fully satisfied by aggregated outputs

new_task_to_execute.description: Array of new tasks to execute

summary.description: Concise summary of the subtree results if requirements are met

useful_output_path.description: Array of output paths that contain useful results to be preserved in the compacted artifact

new_task_to_execute: Add a concise command (or set of commands for different operating systems) that lists the contents of the home directory (e.g., Linux/macOS: ls -al ~ ; Windows (PowerShell): Get-ChildItem -Force $HOME).
arguments.think_process: Root task description actually includes two distinct tasks: (1) Write a command which can list out the contents of the home directory. (2) Write a welcome message for new users joining the platform. Current work only delivers the welcome message copy (comprehensive, with multiple variants). Missing piece: no command provided for listing home directory contents. Therefore requirements not fully satisfied. To fix: provide appropriate command(s) for different OS contexts or at least a default Unix-like command. After adding that, both tasks will be covered.

parameters.prompt:
You're assigning compact, unique short names to newly generated tasks. Requirements:
- Ensure uniqueness across all existing short names
- Keep names discriminative and concise
- Use the same language as each task's description
- Keep names under 15 words
- You can change existing names if needed to ensure uniqueness

Use the XML blocks below. Do not include any markdown. Return only via the function call with assignments for ALL new tasks.

<existing_short_names>

</existing_short_names>

<current_task>
<task_id>test-task-1</task_id>
<description>
Write a command which can list out the contents of the home directory. Task: Write a welcome message for new users joining our platform
</description>
<short_name>Write a command which can list out the contents...</short_name>
</current_task>

<new_tasks>
<task>
<task_id>2393f089d7d301e0</task_id>
<description>
Add a concise command (or set of commands for different operating systems) that lists the contents of the home directory (e.g., Linux/macOS: ls -al ~ ; Windows (PowerShell): Get-ChildItem -Force $HOME).
</description>
</task>
</new_tasks>

function.name: assign_short_names
function.description: Assign unique, short names for tasks in one batch

assignments.short_name: Home directory listing commands: Unix & Windows
